basics.name: Marcin Ostaszewski
basics.label: Front-end Developer (Mid)
basics.summary: Front-end developer with over 6 years of experience in Scrum and Kanban methodologies, including more than 3 years working in multinational teams. Specialising in ReactJS (with Typescript, MobX or Redux, Hooks and Router), I also posess strong skills in Vanilla JS and some experience with AngularJS. Well prepared for debugging, maintaining and developing both modern and legacy code.

keywords: SCSS, SASS, CSS, CSS in JS, Styled Components
Tools: Jira, Azure, GitHub, Bitbucket, SalesForce
skills.name: Frontend

work.name: Medallia
work.summary: Medallia is in top 5 worldwide companies for Customer Experience
highlights: I quickly familiarized myself with a large codebase of multiple microservices built with JS, React and AngularJS, successfully identifying and resolving numerous bugs.
Efficiently implemented numerous new features and complete views in a newly created service using modern React with Typescript, MobX, Router, Context API and Styled Components.
Collaborated actively with an international team of over 20 members, conducting code reviews and adding unit tests in Jest for existing code.
Occasionally participated in on-call support, finding reasons and proposing solutions for bugs reported by clients.

work.name: Magnetic Point
work.summary: Web development partner with over 20 years on the market, cooperating with various software companies from western Poland
highlights: Developed multiple subpages in Adobe Experience Manger (AEM) and added numerous new features for international clients, including Velo, EY, Bat, Coutts and Shell.
Qualified to work with a 20+ member international SCRUM team, for a major British e-commerce company, Halfords.
Effectively resolved all reported bugs and implemented new features, consistently enhancing the quality of both new and existing code using SalesForce, JS, jQuery, HTML, SASS, Zeplin and Jest.
Reviewing front-end and, to a lesser extent, back-end code changes, collaborating closely with back-end developers, UI designers, and QA team using Git, Azure DevOps and Bitbucket.

work.name: AZA Group
work.summary: Fashion e-commerce company from Poland, with branches in several countries of Central Europe, and an internal development team
highlights: Successfully working with three distinct codebases simultaneously: JS and jQuery, modern JS within a CakePHP framework, and ReactJS with TypeScript and Redux.
Efficiently resolved bugs, and enhanced the quality and readability of legacy code, making code reviews, solving dozens of complex CSS problems.

Refactored and greatly improved a medium-sized administrative single-page application, using ReactJS, Redux, TypeScript, Ant Design, Hooks and Router, completing the project well ahead of the deadline.

work.name: Marcel SA
work.summary: One of the leaders in software development for laboratories in Poland, with over 30 years of experience and almost 100 employees.
highlights: I improved many features of a web app's UI and graphic design (HTML, CSS, JS, Jinja, AngularJS).
I wrote over a hundred of E2E tests of an AngularJS web app (Selenium Webdriver, JS).
Single-handedly maintaining an internal templating system for medical documentation, used by hundreds of clients across Poland.

work.name: Mashkor
work.summary: Software development team of 5 persons, assembled in Warsaw to realise a project for a start-up from Kuwait
highlights: Independently developed a comprehensive multi-view admin panel for managing a complex database via multiple REST endpoints. (JS, jQuery, HTML, SASS, REST, Bootstrap).
Implementing new features almost every week and making weekly client demos (Azure, Git).

interests.name: fantasy miniature modeling, do-it-yourself, fantasy and SF books, bike riding, board games
